template.description: For processors where the errors cannot be captured directly as a flowfile attribute, this flow will query the bulletin board for the processor in consideration and retrieve the error information for the same. Date : 03-12-2018 Author : Prajakta Kumbhojkar (212712077)
template.name: Error_Handling_By_Querying_Bulletin_Board

processGroups.comments: Error Handling by querying the Bulletin Board with the processor's component_ID.

labels.label:
GenerateFlowFile :
This is the processor for which errors need to be captured. GenerateFlowfile is a sample processor. Depending on the use case, this could be any other processor.

UpdateSourceID :
This sets the 'sourceId' attribute which is required as a parameter in the API call for querying the bulletin board. This attribute holds the Id of the processor that needs to be monitored and checked for errors (in this case, GenerateFlowFile). It can be taken from that processor's configurations -> SETTINGS tab. This needs to be explicitly changed if the processor Id changes.

APICallForAccessToken :
API call to get the access token. This API Call is environment-dependent and requires SSL Context Service. The access token is returned as response body.

GenerateRequestBody :
Flowfile content is replaced with the username and password required to make the API call for the access token.

APICallToBulletinBoard :
REST API call to query the bulletin board. This API Call is environment-dependent and requires SSL Context Service. The API takes the sourceId as a parameter. This is the Id of the processor for which the bulletin board has to be queried for the error. Another parameter can be limit which limits number of errors returned as the response. This value is hard-coded. The response is a JSON array where each element is an error for the specified component and the corresponding information.

NOTE -
LogAttribute :
The LogAttribute processors signify a logical termination. If further processing is required, other processors may be used in their place.

MonitorActivity :
This monitors the processor for inactivity of any kind for a specified time period (configurable). In case the previous processor is inactive for the specified time period, this processor will send a flowfile to its 'inactive' relationship stating that the said processor has been inactive for the specified period of time. When there is no activity from the previous processor, it could be mean that it has encountered an error which cannot be explicitly captured through its 'failure' relationship.

ExtractErrorInfoFromBulletinLogs :
This extracts a specific error and its corresponding information from the array that is returned. This information can be used further as needed.

ExtractAccessToken :
The access token is present in the incoming flowfile's content. This processor extracts it into an attribute value.

NOTE :
The Id for processors changes if the processor is moved (or copy-pasted) within process groups or environments.
